title: Data
text: data within application collected grantee format compliant HMIS Data Standards. data originates one separate HMIS databases State. HMIS databases capability query database export .zip file. .zip file can uploaded COHHIO Youth Data Dashboard app via app’s “Upload” page.

title: Data
text: following architecture diagram shows app can used uploading (.zip file) HMIS data, visualizing previously uploaded HMIS data.

title: Data
text: following requirements must satisfied order .zip file successfully processed data written database: file must .zip extension Client.csv CurrentLivingSituation.csv Disabilities.csv EmploymentEducation.csv Enrollment.csv Exit.csv Export.csv Funder.csv HealthAndDV.csv IncomeBenefits.csv Organization.csv Project.csv ProjectCoC.csv Services.csv Organization.csv file must contain exactly one (1) organization column naming conventions must match expectations ryha database

text: data dictionary element across file can found . data dictionary used develop package datasets, created data-raw stored data.

title: Development Environment
text: .devcontainer directory contains necessary files set development container: .env.example example file shows set RENV_PATHS_CACHE_HOST environment variable (required configure renv’s cache) based upon Windows OS. need create file named .env directory .env.example set RENV_PATHS_CACHE_HOST value path local machine based upon {renv}’s Cache location. runs renv::restore() restore project’s dependencies renv.lock file installs development-packages (.e. packages needed run application useful development, devtools). can add remove development-packages script based preferences. ’s recommended specify exact package versions prevent unintended updates packages. configures R Language Server updating R_LIBS_USER environment variable, ensuring points correct library path devcontainer.json describes VS Code start container connects. app: custom-built application container mounts local directories runs indefinitely. db: PostgreSQL database container persistent storage exposed ports access. Check db section instructions connect , populate launch application connected database. pgadmin: pgAdmin container database management. Check pgadmin section instructions configure server. Dockerfile.Dev contains set instructions build Docker image run application development. new system requirement needed additional R packages installed must added file.

title: Development Environment
text: Docker. recommend installing via Docker Desktop. VS Code VS Code’s Dev Container Extension

title: Development Environment
text: installed necessary requirements, cloned repository locally created .devcontainer/.env file, open repository VSCode click Reopen Container…:  NOTE: Alternatively, can select Dev Containers: Reopen Container Command Palette (F1) perform action. Dev Container initialization may take minutes, needs create different Docker images install corresponding R packages via renv::restore(). following messages TERMINAL tab indicate process completed successfully:  Follow instructions configure R Language Server:  NOTE: Developer: Reload Window needs run Rebuild. need run Reopen container. NOTE: encounter errors, can review logs troubleshoot contact team member assistance. launch R Terminal, select R: Create R terminal Command Palette (F1). Alternatively, can click ⌄ icon VS Code Panel select R Terminal:  Remember select R Terminal right sidebar open .

title: Development Environment
text: exit Dev Container, click Dev Container (bottom left corner) select one following commands: Reopen Folder Locally: option close current Dev Container session reopen project folder local environment, outside containerized setup. ’s useful want switch back local development environment keeping project open. Close Remote Connection: close connection Dev Container stop container. current workspace closed, ’ll returned main VS Code window without active workspace connection.

title: Development Environment
text: NOTE: work project regular basis, ’s necessary remove Dev Container exit . remove Dev Container: Exit Dev Container Remove container Remove associated images Remove associated volumes Warning: Removing volumes delete development database data ’ve uploaded, requiring repopulate database rebuilding. choose delete container associated images (.e. don’t delete volumes), development database available rebuild Dev Container. following steps demonstrate remove container, images volumes using Docker Desktop. can also use Docker’s command-line interface perform tasks.

title: Development Environment
text: Go Containers tab Locate container associated Dev Container click corresponding trash icon stop delete

title: Development Environment
text: Go Images tab Locate images associated Dev Container click corresponding trash icons remove local Docker repository

title: Development Environment
text: Go Volumes tab Search ryha Select associated volumes Click Delete

title: Development Environment
text: container uses Docker Compose initialize following services:

title: Development Environment
text: app creates container based .devcontainer/Dockerfile.Dev. file: installs R version used project installs R packages’ system requirements installs renv version used project addition, app service defines Volume leverage use renv cache. RENV_PATHS_CACHE_HOST environmental variable needs set .devcontainer/.env. Resources: {renv}’s Cache location. article helps find renv’s cache located machine. GitHub Issue comment shows examples state path working Windows machine. setting network_mode property service:db, can use host = "localhost" connecting development database inside Dev Container. configuration ensures connection string remains regardless whether connecting inside outside Dev Container (ports property set db service). Without network_mode setting, need use host = "db", resulting different connection strings depending context, something want avoid. run app development mode (without installing {ryha} R package), run golem::run_dev().

title: Development Environment
text: db creates postgreSQL database. can find credentials db’s environment property .devcontainer/docker-compose.yml. ports property allows database accessible host machine (.e., outside Dev Container). property set, connection string use host = "localhost" external access. configuration ensures connection string remains regardless whether connecting outside inside Dev Container (network_mode property set app service).

title: Development Environment
text: can connect development database using following code:
code: # Connect to dev database con <- DBI::dbConnect(     drv = RPostgres::Postgres(),     dbname = "ryha-dev",     host = "localhost",     port = 5432,     user = "ryha-dev",     password = "ryha" )

title: Development Environment
text: container created, can run postgres/populate_dev_database/populate_dev_database.R create populate corresponding tables. run script need : Store dm.rds directory postgres/populate_dev_database/data. dm.rds snapshot database production. needs created someone access production database. process generate object read table database list dataframes element named table name data read . Run devtools::load_all(".") access different functions ryha used script (e.g. send_to_db()).

title: Development Environment
text: container running, can set environmental variable APP_BACKEND dev .Renviron run application connected development database.

title: Development Environment
text: pgAdmin provides graphical administration tool make easier manipulate schema data PostgreSQL. container created, can access pgAdmin http://localhost:5050/ following credentials (defined pgadmin’s environment property .devcontainer/docker-compose.yml): User: admin@secret.io Password: admin NOTE: pgAdmin may function correctly web browsers. recommend using Google Chrome. logged , follow steps Register Server: Go Object > Register > Server.... Alternatively, can right-click Servers shown :  General, provide Name server. example: dev-db.  Connection, set following configuration: Host name/address: db. value needs match service name. Port: 5432 Maintenance database: ryha-dev Username: ryha-dev Password: ryha Maintenance database, Username Password defined db’s environment property .devcontainer/docker-compose.yml.  Click Save. development database already populated, able see tables data:

title: Authors and Citation
text: Ketchbrook Analytics. Author. Trevin Flickinger. Maintainer.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Analytics K (2025). ryha: R Youth Homelessness Analyzer. R package version 1.7.0, https://cohhio.github.io/ryha/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {ryha: R Youth Homelessness Analyzer},   author = {Ketchbrook Analytics},   year = {2025},   note = {R package version 1.7.0},   url = {https://cohhio.github.io/ryha/}, }

title: R Youth Homelessness Analyzer
text: goal ryha provide web-based application -depth, user-friendly provision & consumption Youth Homelessness data across State Ohio.

title: R Youth Homelessness Analyzer
text: Shiny application built using {golem} framework, means app actually R package. can install ryha :

title: R Youth Homelessness Analyzer
text: launching app: must determine environment used create data model. accomplished setting APP_BACKEND environmental variable. Valid options : prod, connects database production dev, connects internal database set using dev containers. Check Development Environment article learn set . file, reads provided .rds data model object require database connection. connecting database (.e. APP_BACKEND=prod APP_BACKEND=dev) must following additional configuration able upload data app write database: Environment Variable (uploading data app): UPLOAD_PWD: sets password required upload data database. Hash keys developed encrypting data writing process (stored root directory, needed writing database) connecting database production (.e. APP_BACKEND=prod) must following additional configurations set interact database: Environment Variables: DB_NAME: database name. specifies name specific database within PostgreSQL server want connect. DB_HOST: host address PostgreSQL server. case, particular domain name (e.g. db.example.com). DB_PORT: port number PostgreSQL server listening connections. DB_USER: username used authenticate PostgreSQL server. user must necessary permissions connect specified database. DB_PWD: password associated specified user account. used authentication purposes ensure connection secure. Environmental variables stored .Renviron file located root directory. installing package, can launch app using package’s run_app() function.

title: Generate a bar chart using echarts4r — bar_chart
text: data data frame containing data plotted. x character string specifying column name data frame representing x-axis values. y character string specifying column name data frame representing y-axis values. pct_denominator Optional numeric value specifying denominator percentage calculation. axis_flip logical value indicating whether flip x y axes. Default TRUE. tooltip_opts named list additional tooltip options passed echarts4r's e_tooltip(). Supports confine extraCssText options.

title: Generate a bar chart using echarts4r — bar_chart
text: bar chart visualized using echarts4r.

Either "enrollment" (default) "youth". "enrollment": Filters data based personal_id, organization_id enrollment_id. "youth": Filters data based personal_id organization_id.

what: Filter most recent data per enrollment — filter_most_recent_data_per_enrollment
title: Filter most recent data per enrollment — filter_most_recent_data_per_enrollment
text: filter_most_recent_data_per_enrollment() filters recent data enrollments data collected multiple data collection stages following set rules.

title: Filter most recent data per enrollment — filter_most_recent_data_per_enrollment
Filter most recent data per enrollment — filter_most_recent_data_per_enrollment
text: data data frame multiple rows per enrollment

title: Filter most recent data per enrollment — filter_most_recent_data_per_enrollment
text: data frame one row per enrollment

title: Filter most recent data per enrollment — filter_most_recent_data_per_enrollment
text: enrollment's recent data corresponds data collected "Project exit". enrollment "Project exit", recent data corresponds data collected "Project update" recent date_updated ("Project update" includes "Project update" "Project annual assessment" data_collection_stages). enrollment multiple "Project update" recent date_updated, tie broken selecting first appearance. Finally, enrollment "Project update", recent data corresponds data collected "Project start". general rules described applicable certain scenarios (e.g. Employment data collected "Project start" "Project exit" definition, showing missing data entries correspond "Project update"). address issue, function's users expected preprocess data accordingly calling filter_most_recent_data_per_enrollment() (e.g. filtering data correspond "Project update" data collection stage).

title: Filter most recent data per enrollment — filter_most_recent_data_per_enrollment
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ mock_data <- tibble::tribble(     ~test_row, ~organization_id, ~personal_id, ~enrollment_id, ~data_collection_stage, ~date_updated, ~status,     1, 1L, 1L, 1000L, "Project start", "2024-12-31", "A",     2, 1L, 1L, 1000L, "Project update", "2023-01-01", "B" ) |>     dplyr::mutate(dplyr::across(date_updated, as.Date))  filter_most_recent_data_per_enrollment(mock_data) } # }

what: Filter most recent enrollment per group — filter_most_recent_enrollment_per_group
title: Filter most recent enrollment per group — filter_most_recent_enrollment_per_group
text: filter_most_recent_enrollment_per_group() filters dataset retain recent enrollment group, based series prioritization criteria

title: Filter most recent enrollment per group — filter_most_recent_enrollment_per_group
Filter most recent enrollment per group — filter_most_recent_enrollment_per_group
text: data data frame containing enrollment information grouping_vars character vector specifying grouping variables define groups within data.

title: Filter most recent enrollment per group — filter_most_recent_enrollment_per_group
text: data frame one enrollment per group

title: Filter most recent enrollment per group — filter_most_recent_enrollment_per_group
text: recent enrollment determined following prioritization criteria, applied sequentially: Retain enrollment(s) without exit date recent exit date. Retain enrollment(s) recent entry date. Retain enrollment(s) recent date_updated. Retain enrollment highest enrollment_id final tie-breaker.

title: Filter most recent enrollment per group — filter_most_recent_enrollment_per_group
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ mock_data <- tibble::tribble(     ~organization_id, ~personal_id, ~enrollment_id, ~entry_date, ~exit_date, ~date_updated,     1L, 1L, 1000L, "2022-01-01", "2022-12-31", "2022-12-31",     1L, 1L, 1001L, "2023-01-01", NA, "2023-01-01" ) |>     dplyr::mutate(         dplyr::across(c(entry_date, exit_date, date_updated), as.Date)     )  filter_most_recent_enrollment_per_group(mock_data, c("personal_id", "organization_id")) } # }

title: Run the Shiny Application — run_app
text: Run Shiny Application

title: Run the Shiny Application — run_app
code: run_app(   onStart = NULL,   options = list(),   enableBookmarking = NULL,   uiPattern = "/",   ... )

title: Run the Shiny Application — run_app
text: onStart function called app actually run. needed shinyAppObj, since shinyAppDir case, global.R file can used purpose. options Named options passed runApp call (can following: "port", "launch.browser", "host", "quiet", "display.mode" "test.mode"). can also specify width height parameters provide hint embedding environment ideal height/width app. enableBookmarking Can one "url", "server", "disable". default value, NULL, respect setting previous calls  enableBookmarking(). See enableBookmarking() information bookmarking app. uiPattern regular expression applied GET request determine whether ui used handle request. Note entire request path must match regular expression order match considered successful. ... arguments pass golem_opts. See ?golem::get_golem_options details.

what: Generate a Sankey chart using echarts4r — sankey_chart
title: Generate a Sankey chart using echarts4r — sankey_chart
text: function generates Sankey chart using echarts4r package.

title: Generate a Sankey chart using echarts4r — sankey_chart
code: sankey_chart(data, entry_status, exit_status, count, color = palette$default)

title: Generate a Sankey chart using echarts4r — sankey_chart
text: data data frame containing data plotted. entry_status character string specifying column name data frame representing entry status flow. exit_status character string specifying column name data frame representing exit status flow. count character string specifying column name data frame representing count value associated flow. color character string specifying color Sankey chart. Default "blue".

title: Generate a Sankey chart using echarts4r — sankey_chart
text: Sankey chart visualized using echarts4r.

title: Generate a Sankey chart using echarts4r — sankey_chart
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ mock_data <- data.frame(     status_at_entry = c("A", "A", "B", "B"),     status_at_exit = c("X", "Y", "Y", "Z"),     n = c(10, 20, 30, 20) ) sankey_chart(     data = mock_data,     entry_status = "status_at_entry",     exit_status = "status_at_exit",     count = "n",     color = "green" ) } # }

title: Add custom Bootstrap popover — with_popover
text: with_popover() creates Bootstrap popover containing additional information display alongside given text.

title: Add custom Bootstrap popover — with_popover
text: text text display. content content display inside popover. placement placement popover relative text. Defaults "right".

title: Add custom Bootstrap popover — with_popover
text: HTML Bootstrap popover containing specified content.

title: Add custom Bootstrap popover — with_popover
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ with_popover(     text = "Some Example Text",     content = shiny::tagList(         shiny::span("First description line."),         shiny::br(),         shiny::span("Second description line.")     ) ) } # }
